Creating great content is important, yes, but it's not the only thing you should do. You have to make sure people can find you and your videos. And there are a couple of steps you can take for that:  Create relevant content. Find out what people are looking for, and make content about it. Right now, post match analyses of World Cup games are in high demand. Whenever a Game of Thrones episode airs, people are looking for reviews right after it. I once uploaded a video about a football coach that was just fired on a brand new (empty) channel. It got 7,000 views in only two days. Of course, you should always create content that you like to make, but if you can tie it to current affairs, that's always a win.Add value to your channel. Be sure to know what your channel is about and what people get out of subscribing you. I have a successful YouTube channel on which I give tips for starting YouTubers. If people watch my videos, they get some valuable info that they can use for their channels. And after watching that video, they want more tips, so they subscribe. If your videos are informative, inspirational or very entertaining, convince people that they can get more of that stuff if they subscribe to you.Work on your channel. Think up a nice title. Create a good banner. Get yourself a nice profile picture. Be sure to fill in the channel description. Include keywords in your channel settings (in the Video Manager). Create a good channel trailer. Use playlists for your content. In short: make your channel look appealing and inviting.Upload regularly. This is really important! Create new content on a regular basis. If people see that you haven't uploaded anything new for a long time, they won't subscribe to you. And people who have subscribed to you will forget why they did that in the first place.Make your subscriptions and likes public. This is very important for step 6. You can do this in your channel settings.Communicate with other YouTubers. You're not alone on that big website, even if it can feel that way when you've just started out. There are thousands of people who start out on YouTube every day. Get to know a couple of them. I've built a website called The YouTube ChannelCrawler, which lists thousands and thousands of YouTube channels. Not just the big ones, but especially the smaller ones. Look for interesting channels in the 0 to 250 subscriber range. Subscribe to them (they'll get an e-mail if you did step 5). Write nice comments on their videos. Support them. In short: be an active and loyal viewer to other YouTubers. A lot of them will appreciate that a lot and take a look at your channel as well. And those who don't and who never reply can be easily unsubscribed. Just keep in mind that you should never demand or expect people to subscribe you back. If you give your support to others, unconditionally and relentlessly, you will get the same support back.Hope this helps. Good luck, and post a link to your YouTube channel in a comment to this answer. I wouldn't mind taking a look at it :).

13 Ways To Increase Your YouTube Subscribers 1. Monitor “attention score” to measure good storytelling YouTube executive Bing Chen says, “Another thing that cannot be replaced is good storytelling. We really recommend you go into your dashboard and look at your attention score.” What exactly is your attention score? This shows you the level of attention and the length of time people spend watching your videos. Here’s what makes a great entertaining video: Five-second rule – A great entertaining video must grab people in the first five seconds. You can use questions or put yourself into an unusual situation. And don’t forget the conflict. People have to get a feeling of suspense immediately.Storytelling – Bing Chen says this is essential. Learn the tricks of weaving a good story so that people will hang with you through the duration of the video. You can use gimmick or conflict to achieve that.Short – Entertaining videos can’t be too long. Between one and three minutes is ideal. This is where looking at your attention score is critical. Where are people dropping off? Is that the upper reaches of attention span?Early attention score is low – Most of the traffic drops off early. People decide quickly whether they will learn what they want to learn from a video.Late attention score is high – Those who stay past the two or three minute mark will typically stay for the entire video.Steps – Great informative videos pull people along by giving them systematic steps to accomplish a particular task. In fact, people may tend to pause the video and write notes or actually perform the task. Think about how you would learn to fold a paper airplane or fix a sink.Length – It doesn’t matter how long your informative video is as long as you are giving people the answers they need.2. Five steps to planning a good video Keyword research – You won’t get traffic, let alone high-quality traffic, if you don’t do your research with keywords. Google’s keyword tool will show you what’s hot and has the highest volume. Avoid the long-tail keywords.Transcript – After you’ve recorded the video, grab the transcript and upload it to YouTube. This will give Google more context to help index it and give you an additional number of words to help people searching.Social Media Engagement – Work your social networks. Share the video two or three times a week on Facebook, Twitter and Google+ each. The more shares you can get, the more your video will rise in the rankings.Your Blog – After about a week, embed the video on your site. Then you can go through the process of sharing it again.Read More Wait 5 second skip ad open link

There is no way to 100% guarantee that you will get a lot of subscribers, but here are some tips to increase your odds. Make quality content. Spend time planning out your videos, don’t just make a video for the sake of making a video. If your videos are interesting, people will want to watch them and subscribe.Have good lighting. If your videos look like they were filmed in a dark basement, people won’t want to subscribe to you.Learn about Search Engine Optimization. I’m still far from an expert in terms of SEO, but having a basic understanding about using key words and tags really helps you rank in YouTube search.Make eye-catching thumbnails. Thumbnails are very important because it’s one of the first things people see. If you’re thumbnail is awful, no one will click on your video and subscribe.Reply to comments. You want to create a community on your channel. If you respond to people who comment on your videos, they feel like they have a personal connection with you. They’re more likely to stay and subscribe because you’ve had a conversation with them.Comment on other people’s channels. Find other channels that make similar content and comment something. Don’t promote yourself, just try to establish a connection. They may read your comment and check out your channel and subscribe. This is also a great way to find people to collab with, which goes along with my next tip…….Collab with people. Collaborations are a great way to grow your YouTube audience. Find people who are willing to collab with you and do it!Post consistently. People tend to subscribe to channels who post regularly. If you aren’t putting out consistent content, your chances of growing on YouTube decrease substantially.Ask people to subscribe. It may sound simple, but asking people to subscribe can sometimes help grow your channel. While it’s constantly on the mind of the video creator, it’s not always on the mind of the viewer. Sometimes the viewer didn’t even think about subscribing, but will if you ask them.I hope these tips help! Remember, it takes time to grow a channel. These tips will help you, but it won’t make you a YouTube sensation over night. Have a great day!

Marketing is the biggest thing. If you can afford the publicity then great, otherwise you can still do it but it will be slower. Here are some suggestions to get more subscribers on YouTube. Optimize your YouTube video for search engines  Make sure your YouTube video title includes the keywords your viewers will search for. Then, when you write a video description, make sure to include those keywords / phrases. Do not sacrifice flow or clarity for keyword density. Google rewarded for good content and punished keyword stuffing. Once your YouTube videos show more with search engines, they will also show up better to your viewers as they find your content easier. Each new viewer is a new potential subscriber! Use keywords in the title. This has a greater impact on SEO in the past, but it still has a big impact on the video. Google's crawlers do not view videos in the way they read blog posts, so placing keywords in the title will allow Google bots to know the content of your video. Add an end screen to promote your video, channel, or website End screens are interactive graphics that link to another video, playlist, channel or site, or prompts someone to subscribe to your channel. As the feature name suggests, you can only add a screen that ends in the last 20 seconds of the video, so you have to plan where the display ends. Collaborate with other YouTube users A great way to increase subscribers is by appearing on other YouTube Channels. Try to select channels whose subscribers might be interested in your video. The best way to do this is to become part of Google's dedicated community. Create a list of YouTubers and then contact each of them. Regularly post new content Consistency is always the key to any social network. Posting once and waiting for new subscribers or subscribers is simply not working. On the other hand, when you post regularly and continually add new content to your channel, you give users a reason to subscribe.

I’m going to copy- paste an answer I gave on someone else’s similar question. Sorry to disappoint, friend, but there is no secret. Like every other job, it takes a lot of hard work and determination, more than most people think. YouTube is not a free ticket to success in any way, shape, form, or fashion, despite what some assume. YouTube is a place where you can make content for others to enjoy, it is a creative outlet, and that alone is what separates it from some other jobs.There are some ways you can grab people’s attention. #1 Good Thumbnails- Yeah I get it, seems trivial right? Well, not really. To get people to subscribe they must be interested in the content you make, and before they get interested in your personality and see your video they must (obviously) watch your video. How do you grab said attention? Make good thumbnails, it will stir interest. #2 Good Title - Same psychology as the first one, make it look professional. #3 Good (honest) Promotion - DO NOT go on other people’s channels and comment asking to subscribe, as a content creator myself, i block every single channel that does it… you come to my channel as a place to enjoy MY content, not promote your own. Make a twitter, tweet regularly. Make a Facebook, post regularly. Tell friends and family, seems weird… but family will be a good place of support sometimes. Reddit works for a good amount of YouTubers as well. #4 Network - Find channels as your own, and collaborate with them! Even if you’re mainly solo it won’t hurt! Maybe you’ll find good friends and some of their subs will leak to you and vice-versa. #5 Be honest and creative - Easier said then done, I understand, but it’s okay to do a similar video style, it’s okay to have inspiration, but be sure to not copy other people. If you be original and do things your own way you will develop your own sense of style. #6 Be confident and persistent - This one is my personal toughie, spending a good amount of time on a video and it not getting the feedback you hoped for, keep pushing, unless you are EXTREMELY LUCKY you are not going to be successful overnight, work hard. Keep at it. Be confident in the content you provide, confidence and persistence breeds IMPROVEMENT. #7 Last, but certainly not least. WORK HARD - This one goes with number 6, but work as hard as you can, even if you’re not a god at video-making right off the bat, upload it anyways. Put it out there and you eventually will breed your own sense of style. KEEP AT IT! Thanks for reading, I hope I helped! Cheers! :D

No single way, but a number of steps you have to take each time you are making a video. I assume your goal is to earn money with YouTube. In this case, I would define five key characteristics that I noticed every successful YouTube channel has. The Message. Channel has to have a message that it wants to share. There should be a goal and a purpose to what you do and share there. Is your channel about photography? Your message might be that everybody can learn this following your easy tips. And your goal then might be to share your knowledge about photography, and also make it fun or present it in a aesthetically beautiful way. Are you making book reviews? Your message might be that not every book is worth reading or has some wisdom, intrinsic value to it. Your goal would be to review new or upcoming books and tell what fascinated you, what you learned, how it made your life better or how much fun you had.The Creed. That is a whole system of your believes. This is what makes you different or similar to brands. It takes a lot of work, but all big YouTube channels have their creed and, thus, brands. They become brands. And brands unite people around them and create communities (followers, zealots).The Tone. One day you are funny and gregarious, the other day you are nerdy or cheeky, and the other day you are depressed and gloomy. Unless you are doing a personal V-log, that’s not what people would like to see. Unless that’s is your character and people know that well, it’s unlinkely too work. They want to know what to expect of you. Look at Peter McKinnon - always positive, lighthearted, playful. Or at Sean Tucker - serious, deep and thoughtful. And Thomas Heaton - kind, sincere and sometimes gawky. All three are photographers (and YouTubers) with distinct characters and tone.High quality. Of videos and the content. Gone are the days when you could just record a game that you play or a reviews of some product with free software or on your phone or an old camera. Shaky footage, bad lighting, resolution of less than 720p - avoid them! Content is the king, however. Do your research. What people need and want, and what there already is. How can you satisfy them in your own way? Great content always beats mediocre or even bad quality. If you create great content (what people want in a way that people like) in great quality - you will achieve success.Consistency. Of your message. In your upload frequency, in the tone and in the quality of videos. People stick to channels which content they can predict to some degree. Information should be new, but the structure of each and every video and of your channel should be the same.However, if you are not doing YouTube for money, then your passion will make you wanted on its own. It may time more time, but eventually your contagious interest will engage audiences and they will follow you despite other imperfections. And the money will come with them. P.S. Remember: Content>everything else.

Create a release schedule  When you visit any YouTube channel, you'll see every channel has a banner and you want to make sure, if you will release a video every week, make sure you choose a day of the week that you release it. Make sure your content follows this golden rule to make your audience trust so that when they encounter a problem they can solve, they will come to you. Advertise your YouTube videos on other social channels  One of the great things about social media is that you can cross-promote content across different channels. Hi, thanks for the question. I would love to share some tips with you on to get more Youtube likes/subscribers for your channel. Tips to get more Youtube likes/subscribers: Create a script for your videosFirstly, you may need to plan what your channel is going to be all about, who is your target audience, what is your audience preferences, what your audience would like to see and etc. Then you have to write your script based your understanding towards audience needs and wants. This script will also ensure a perfect flow of events resulting in a well-focused video. You should include as many details as possible into your video script such as the exact words you are going to say, the actions you will be taking in the video, the main points you need to stress and any necessary calls to action (click on this link, subscribe to my channel, etc.) Increase your uploading frequency/ConsistentYouTube subscribers usually do not like channels that don’t produce regular content.Upload your videos in a timely, recurring, and structured trend. Google Adwords is a good tool to help you identify what people are searching for on the web. Make sure that your title not too long and do not use the word “video” in the title. You have to make the title engaging and descriptive to get more clicks. Let people find youYouTube provides an option to link to your official web page or blog. If you’ve got one, make sure you do it. You may add yout website/blog URL to your channel under the channel settings. You may also consider adding your website/blog URL in the channel description itself. Knowing how to increase your YouTube subscribers is the secret to getting more views, therefore more money. If you can increase your subscribers, you will start to get the domino effect, which is where people see your channel has a lot of subscribers, so they sign up just because of that. If you have no subscribers, people will assume your channel is not very interesting since nobody is liking it - let's change that right now.  The Fastest Way To Increase Your YouTube Subscribers OK so, no one really wants to bother with strategies that require a whole lot of money or time, so here are some simple strategies you can implement immediately to increase your YouTube subscriber list exponentially. Just remember that if your videos are lacking- nothing will get you more subscribers unless they are super funny! 1. Interact With Your Audience. If you want to increase your YouTube subscribers, you have to be real. Sure, Rihanna has millions of views on her videos and she doesn't interact... Or does she? You listen to her music while you are in the shower - that counts as interacting. Seriously though, if you aren't providing music or some other form of passive entertainment, you need to interact with your audience. If you want to increase your YouTube subscribers on your channel and you do product reviews, information videos or tutorials, you need to help people through the comments, have a Facebook account set up and other ways to allow people to get in touch with you. This might seem like a lot of work at the start but it will pay off and you will begin to increase your YouTube subscribers. 2. Use Social Media. Using social media to increase your YouTube subscribers doesn't mean that you sit on Facebook all day and chat with your friends. It means things like submitting your videos to StumbleUpon, Digg, Reddit and Delicious. These places will bring real traffic to your site, but you need to take the time to give them the right keywords, put them in the right section and actually create accounts to start off with. Once you have the accounts set up it is easy to bookmark each video and increase your YouTube subscribers. 3. Annotate Your Videos. When somebody is watching a video, they can easily forget to subscribe even though they may love your stuff. Increase your YouTube subscribers add a call to action or CPA by annotating your videos and remind them to subscribe, comment or otherwise persuade them to join up. Also remember that annotations can be incredibly annoying and a lot of people close them, so a good strategy can be to have it pop up near the end, or just briefly pop up for a few seconds throughout the video. If it runs through the whole video your comment section will be full of people hating you! 4. Target Your Videos Properly. Write a great headline that people will actually want to search for. Chances are 1 in a million that you will produce something that just "goes viral", so you have to work hard to find out what words people will type into YouTuber Google to find your video. If you are writing a video about how to plumb up a toilet, you could title your video "How To Plumb Up A Toilet - By A Registered Plumber". Your headline is the first thing people will see, as well as the image you place beside it. You want to make sure that your headline and image (post thumbnail) say exactly what the video will be about, and you definitely want an image that is HD. This is the simplest way to increase your YouTube subscribers but often overlooked. 5. Hijack Other Video Traffic. It is your duty to jump onto competitors videos and hijack their thread! Well, not quite so brutally as that, however if you found a video that said "How To Rip Out An Old Toilet", you could add a comment to the thread that hints to your video-note that you're taking a chance with this one; it could be well received by the community or you could get booted off. If done correctly though, this could be a very fast way to increase your YouTube subscribers and can help out other viewers at the same time. 6. Ask Questions. Ask questions at the end of your video and get your viewers interested and curious. Encourage them to comment. This is a great way to increase your YouTube subscribers without any extra time spent after creating the video. Trying to get subscribers without communicating with them is like trying to get a loan without going to the bank and asking for one. You could ask users what struggles they are having in the niche you are targeting, what subjects they would like to see you tackle and what questions they have. 7. Post Video Responses To Other Videos. Using our example before about plumbing, if you see a video about how to install a toilet in a brand new house, you could do a video about fixing broken toilets. Try to think about the most common problems that people will have with toilets (or another niche) by talking to real people. Go on some forums in your niche and see what people are struggling with, this is the real way to increase your YouTube subscribers. If you can hone in on their needs, this is what they will type into the search engines and your video will come out on top if it is the best and most targeted. Increasing YouTube Subscribers Is Easy When You Know How To Do It Learning how to increase your YouTube subscribers is like learning anything else - commit to learning and then implement. There are no doubt plenty of ways to increase your YouTube subscribers, but some ways will work better for different niches. Depending on the niche you are attempting to target, you may have to try a combination of several things, however, don't try to do too many strategies all at once. Take the time to think about what skills you have and where your time is best spent. If you are a slow typer, it may be better to hire somebody else to post comments on other threads of competitors. One thing to always remember when trying to increase your YouTube subscribers is that if your videos are great, people will tell their friends about them and you will increase your YouTube subscribers with very little effort. This is the ideal situation for you. Some things to remember are to always record in HD, keyword and title your videos appropriately, be a bit of a character, be an expert (or learn just a little more than the average journeyman) and try to make people enjoy watching the video. If you can do this you will increase your YouTube subscribers a lot faster than your competitors with poor videos. Are You Losing Money trying to Get Leads for your business?
